name: Why Autumn is a Sad Season
description:
A special narrated video poetry piece from David Jones, internationally best selling author and owner of the @storydj instagram account followed by over 270,000 readers.

The piece is experimental and works across multiple mediums through time. It combines classic archive footage from the past with original words and then immortalises them both using modern technology: the blockchain. The aim of the video poem project is to examine how old footage can be given new life and context within a new artistic medium.

How can we use memories of the past, captured on film but long since lapsed into historical archive? Is this footage still relevant? What feelings does it evoke today when paired with original poetry and minted using a new medium? And in answering this question, how do we use and experience our own memories? What can we do with nostalgia? Is it condemned to the past or can it be revitalised through art?

A mingling of past, present and future technology with original worlds, the nostalgic sensation of the poem harks back to the early days of film, while the medium of NFT looks towards the future. The poem explores themes of love, yearning and nostalgia for a long faded past. It’s narrated by the author and is currently the only self narrated piece on sale anywhere. 

Each line of the poem appears on the video along with the narration.

The poem reads:

Why autumn is a sad season

Remember when   
We used to walk
Hand in hand
Beneath the shaded
Boughs?

Those parasol
Seaside months in a
Dreaming pollen
Haze?

It’s autumn now,
And the falling leaves
Remind me
Of you.
